books.Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.Author: Harper Lee
books.About_Book: A story about the life of Elizabeth Bennet, a young woman who learns about love, social expectations, and personal growth.

books.Author: George Orwell
books.About_Book: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, following Winston Smith as he attempts to rebel against the oppressive government led by Big Brother

books.Title: Pride and Prejudice
books.Author: Jane Austen
books.About_Book: The tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt down the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.

books.Title: The Great Gatsby
books.Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.About_Book: A novel about the American Dream, following the life of Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

books.Title: Moby-Dick
books.Author: Herman Melville
books.About_Book: A vast epic novel set during the Napoleonic Wars, focusing on the lives of Russian aristocracy and their struggle during times of war and peace.

books.Title: War and Peace
books.Author: Leo Tolstoy
books.About_Book: A novel about the troubled teenage life of Holden Caulfield, exploring themes of adolescence, identity, and loss.

books.Title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.Author: J.D. Salinger
books.About_Book: A trilogy about Frodo Baggins and his companions, tasked with destroying the One Ring to defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

books.Title: The Hobbit
books.Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.About_Book: An epic poem following the adventures of Odysseus as he struggles to return home after the Trojan War, encountering gods, monsters, and obstacles along the way.

books.Title: The Lord of the Rings
books.Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.About_Book: The novel tells the story of the Joad family as they travel west during the Great Depression, seeking a better life while facing hardship, injustice, and social inequality.

books.Title: The Chronicles of Narnia
books.Author: C.S. Lewis
books.About_Book: A novel set in a dystopian future where society is engineered to create stability and happiness, but at the cost of individual freedom and identity.

books.Title: Brave New World
books.Author: Aldous Huxley
books.About_Book: A novel that tells the tragic story of Victor Frankenstein and the monster he creates, exploring themes of isolation, ambition, and humanity.

books.Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.Author: Oscar Wilde
books.About_Book: The novel tells the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England in order to spread the undead curse, focusing on the battle between Dracula and a group of people trying to stop him.

books.Title: Fahrenheit 451
books.Author: Ray Bradbury
books.About_Book: A novel about a young man, Dorian Gray, whose portrait ages while he remains youthful and unscathed, leading to his eventual moral and physical decline.

books.Title: The Alchemist
books.Author: Paulo Coelho
books.About_Book: The story of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a grand adventure with a group of dwarves to reclaim their home and treasure from the dragon Smaug.

books.Title: Jane Eyre
books.Author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
books.About_Book: A historical novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution, focusing on the themes of resurrection, sacrifice, and the impact of the revolution.

books.Title: The Road
books.Author: Cormac McCarthy
books.About_Book: The novel follows the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, a former student who commits a crime and struggles with guilt and redemption.

books.Title: The Outsiders
books.Author: S.E. Hinton
books.About_Book: A novel about Anna Karenina, a woman trapped in a loveless marriage who embarks on a passionate affair with Count Vronsky, leading to tragic consequences.

books.Title: The Shining
books.Author: Stephen King
books.About_Book: The story revolves around the Karamazov family and the spiritual and philosophical struggles of its members, addressing themes of faith, doubt, and morality.

books.Title: The Girl with the Dragon
books.Author: Stieg Larsson
books.About_Book: An epic poem that tells the journey of Dante through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, guided by the Roman poet Virgil and his beloved Beatrice.

books.Title: The Handmaid's Tale
books.Author: Margaret Atwood
books.About_Book: The story follows Ishmael's journey aboard the whaling ship Pequod, under the obsession of Captain Ahab to capture the giant white whale, Moby-Dick.
